description.narrative: The project supports the Government of Bhutan's efforts toward sustainable urban development in its two largest municipalities (Phuentsholing and Thimphu) and two emerging urban centers (Samdrup Jongkhar Municipality [SJM] and Nganglam Town). It has four outputs: (i) water supply and sanitation (WSS) infrastructure rehabilitation and expansion; (ii) mobility improvement; (iii) urban management strengthening; and (iv) project management and capacity development.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: Improved urban infrastructure for the residents of Phuentsholing, Samdrup Jongkhar and Thimphu municipalities (thromdes) provided.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President
Sewerage coverage increases from 17% in 2011 to 80% in 2018 for Thimphu's southern local areas and core area.

description.narrative: Improved urban infrastructure for the residents of Phuentsholing, Samdrup Jongkhar and Thimphu municipalities (thromdes) provided.

title.narrative: Nonrevenue water in SJM reduced from 50% in 2011 to 35% in 2018.

description.narrative: Improved urban infrastructure for the residents of Phuentsholing, Samdrup Jongkhar and Thimphu municipalities (thromdes) provided.
